description: This course prepares McNair Scholars for the rigors of academic writing. Because the enrolled students represent a variety of disciplines, this course serves as a general introduction to writing in research; it is not meant to replace discipline-specific research methods or writing courses. Students read scholarly literature in their disciplines, write a literature review, draft various sections of a research paper, and prepare for a formal poster presentation. Offered every summer. Prerequisite: successful completion of First Year Seminar or Writing and Rhetoric.
name: McNair Research Writing
notes: Open only to McNair Scholars. Course dates are May 30 to August 4.
prerequisites: successful completion of First Year Seminar or Writing and Rhetoric.
title: McNair Research Writing Across the Disciplines
